name: museum-alexandria-founded
description: The Mouseion of Alexandria was established by Ptolemy I as a center of learning, housing the famous Library of Alexandria.

name: globe-theatre-built
description: Shakespeare's Globe Theatre was constructed in London, becoming the primary venue for his plays and the Lord Chamberlain's Men.

name: new-amsterdam-becomes-new-york
description: The English captured the Dutch colony of New Amsterdam and renamed it New York in honor of the Duke of York.

name: metropolitan-police-founded
description: Sir Robert Peel established the Metropolitan Police Service in London, creating the first modern professional police force.

name: transatlantic-cable-completed
description: The first permanent transatlantic telegraph cable connected Europe and North America, enabling instant communication across the ocean.

name: great-railroad-strike-1877
description: The first major American railroad strike began in West Virginia and spread nationwide, marking a turning point in U.S. labor history.

name: first-commercial-radio-broadcast
description: KDKA in Pittsburgh broadcast the Harding-Cox presidential election results, marking the start of commercial radio broadcasting.
